subtitle.translate: Warnings about the beauties of physics grids.

description: Physics are especially volatile to tinker with, so if you are interacting with some of the more risky mechanisms, a couple of rules are good to keep in mind:
Avoid assembling large amounts of blocks at a time.
Building onto your physics grids after they are assembled is almost always preferable over prebuilding them, for server and client performance.
Build assembled creations with a 2 block gap from any blocks.
This helps avoid stealing unblacklisted assembly blocks (such as certain grasses) or blocks tied by corners.
Construct more advanced things in a singleplayer world first! And please be courteous of your builds; the mod is in alpha for a number of reasons, so caution is advised.
